author: Brendan Kuty | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Drop Kris Bryant? Could Chicago Cubs change lineup for NLCS Game 2?
text:
Comments 
NEW YORK — Maybe Joe Maddon has it all wrong? 
PLUS: Will Chris Christie go with the Mets to Wrigley Field? 
From Rosenbloom: 
The metrics make me wonder why such a metrics-savvy manager continually bats Kris Bryant third on the road given his offensive struggles away from Wrigley Field. 
During the regular season, Bryant's OPS was about 400 points lower on the road. 
Bryant also hit just five of his 26 homers away from Wrigley. He isn't close to the offensive threat on the road that he is at home. 
Bryant entered the National League Championship Series 0-for-11 on the road and promptly went 0-for-3 with a walk in Game 1. 
This is a first-guess: I would've moved up Anthony Rizzo to third because I want him guaranteed an at-bat in the first inning of a road game, then bat Castro or Jorge Soler, and then Bryant fifth. 
Will it happen? Maddon's known for his creativity and flexibility. But he's also not exactly reactionary. 
Maddon may prefer to stick with his current lineup, which he'll also unveil at Wrigley Field, in an effort to help his young stars find and keep normalcy. After all, for most of them, this is the first time they've been to the playoffs, let alone an NLCS. 
Players are creatures of habit, especially young ones who are coping with this type of adversity for the first time. 
Then again, their trust in Maddon — and it's high — might overcome any kind skepticism of the moves he makes.
